<FACE_DUNHILL><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Good morning, <MYNAME>, are you up?

<FACE_DUNHILL><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Today I came to show you how
to grow <RED>crops</RED>!
Would you like to learn?

<FACE_DUNHILL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
The area of ground we are standing on is
called a <RED>field</RED>.
<PAGE>
You can grow <BLUE>8</BLUE> crops in
each field. The area needed to grow one
crop is <RED>1 square</RED>.

<FACE_DUNHILL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Growing crops in a field goes like this:
<RED>tilling</RED>, <RED>sowing</RED>, then <RED>watering</RED>.
When crops grow ripe, you <RED>harvest</RED> them. 
<PAGE>
Till using your <GREEN>hoe</GREEN>, use <GREEN>seeds</GREEN> for
sowing, and your <GREEN>watering can</GREEN>
to water.
<PAGE>
I'll give you your farming tools now,
<MYNAME>.

<FACE_DUNHILL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
You can equip these tools from your bag
screen.
<PAGE>
Right! It's easy to equip a tool using
the <BLUE>R Button</BLUE>.
Give it a try.
<PAGE>
Use the <BLUE>Y Button</BLUE> to put an
equipped tool or item you are carrying
back in your bag.

<FACE_DUNHILL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Now I'll explain the process of growing
crops in detail.
Watch.

The first step is to till the field.
You use your <GREEN>hoe</GREEN> for that.

The highlighted squares will be tilled
when you use your hoe.

Use this indicator to till the
squares that you want.

After tilling comes sowing.<RED>One bag of
seeds is enough for 4 squares</RED>.

But if you sow seeds like the picture
on the right, the seeds won't sow in
all four squares, so be careful. 

To remove seeds, use the <GREEN>hoe</GREEN>.

Next fill the <GREEN>watering can</GREEN> from
the <GREEN>watering spot</GREEN> and water the crops.

Crops must be watered <BLUE>every day</BLUE>
until they are ripe.
<PAGE>
When you water on sunny days, the
water will dry up after a few hours.
Then you should water again.

<RED>Watering twice a day makes your plants
grow faster</RED>.
Try it so you can harvest sooner.

Once the crops have ripened, as this
picture shows, you can <RED>harvest</RED>.

Most crops are harvested by hand, but
some are harvested with a <GREEN>sickle</GREEN>.

Read seed descriptions to see if a
crop should be harvested by sickle.

<FACE_DUNHILL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
And that's the process of growing crops.
I can also explain to you how crops
<RED>wilt</RED> and <RED>die</RED>. Want to hear it?
Learn how crops wilt and die
No thanks

<FACE_DUNHILL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
All right, then look here.

If you forget to water your crops for
a day, they'll <RED>wilt</RED> like this.

If you water wilted crops, they will
recover, but if you skip watering for
a few days, the crops will <RED>die</RED>.
So water your crops promptly!

Some crops only grow at certain times.
You can harvest them right up to the
change of season, but watch out: <RED>ones
that aren't finished growing will die</RED>!

Clear away dead crops with your
<GREEN>sickle</GREEN>. Then you can plant new crops.

<FACE_DUNHILL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
You can also refer to your <BLUE>bookshelf</BLUE>
for the info I just told you.

<FACE_DUNHILL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Okay, that's fine.
<PAGE>
If you have questions about withered
crops or anything else I told you,
refer to your <BLUE>bookshelf</BLUE>.
Listen to explanation
Skip explanation

<FACE_DUNHILL><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Now let's go out to your fields.

<SPEED_IMME>
Acquired <GREEN>tools</GREEN> and <GREEN>seeds</GREEN>!

<FACE_DUNHILL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
By the way, you can buy <GREEN>fertilizer</GREEN>
from the store to improve the quality
of your crops.
<PAGE>
Put it on your crops <RED>once a day</RED>
and see what happens.

<FACE_DUNHILL><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
I've given you the tools and seeds you
need to start farming.

<FACE_DUNHILL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Whoa, <MYNAME>, looks like your bag is
full!
<PAGE>
I'll put these in your <BLUE>toolbox</BLUE> instead.
Take a look at them later.
